summary: **Hybrid Theory**, Linkin Park's first album, came out in 2000. It's named after the band's old name and mixing music styles. The album talks about singer Chester Bennington's tough childhood, like his parents' divorce and drug problems. Four popular songs, or singles, helped make the band famous. The album was a big hit, selling 32 million copies worldwide and winning a Grammy Award. It's still one of the best-selling debut albums. A special 20th anniversary edition was released in 2020 with a new song.
title: Hybrid Theory
